term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - mass transfer coefficient in electrochemistry
term.title: mass transfer coefficient

item.text: The heterogeneous diffusion rate constant defined for the case of the limiting current. A more general definition in terms of the electrode currentdensities is: kd = j.ν/n.F(ce - c0) is the electrode current density, ν is the stoichiometric number, n is the charge number of the electrode reaction, F is the Faraday constant, ce is the interfacial concentration, c0 is the bulk concentration, t B is the transport number of species B, and z B is the charge number of species B.

term.disclaimer: The International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) is continuously reviewing and, where needed, updating terms in the Compendium of Chemical Terminology (the IUPAC Gold Book). Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
